reviews.text: Amazing food, service, and atmosphere!
We had the most delightful waitress. Her name is Mahalia.
Excellent food! The gluten-free chicken and waffles are amazing! Everything here is good. And the people are so nice and great service!
Good food good ambience

We had the best dinner at Friedman's Hell's Kitchen last week. The atmosphere was amazing, the drinks were perfect, and the food was delicious. Gia, our server, was so friendly and kind, and we received everything we asked for in just the right time. I highly recommend.  We will definitely be back.
Muy buena atenciÃ³n. OpciÃ³n gluten free

The food was amazing, staff and service was even better. Would come back anytime Iâ€™m in the neighborhood. Highly recommend!!! The manager Omar made us feel very welcomed, we walked in and there was a wait, which went by quick since he offered us coffee while we waited. He checked in on us often and made sure everything was to our liking. Great place and great people, canâ€™t wait to come back!
Very cozy. Food was amazing.
Great chicken sandwich ğŸ˜Š
First time and as an out of towner, we hit the jackpot on our lunch! Highly recommend!! The atmosphere and the wait staff is incredible!
Great and quick service on a busy Saturday before the NYC marathon, very accommodating and friendly staff!

Has been a fovorite of mine for Years. Always the Best Food, Best Staff, Best Service and feels like home.
Couldn't ask for anything more!!
BEST DRINKS TOO!!!
Great service!
Great breakfast, and service. Not a bad location.
Fantastic gluten free lemon pancakes!

Wir waren zu sechst im Friedmans Restaurant in New York und hatten einen super Abend.

Besonders lecker fanden wir das Pastrami Sandwich â€“ zartes Fleisch, tolle WÃ¼rze, einfach klasse!
Auch der Buttermilk Fried Chicken Burger war ein Highlight: knusprig, saftig und perfekt abgeschmeckt!
Die groÃŸe Auswahl an Bieren hat unser Essen bzw. unseren Abend ideal ergÃ¤nzt.

Preise und Service stimmen ebenfalls â€“ freundlich, aufmerksam und einladend. Wir kommen definitiv wieder!
Amazing food and Juan was great.
Nice spot for some good food
Great, fast, polite service! Receptive to GF requirements. I highly recommend
Excellent!!!would come back
Food was good!
Really lovely

Fizemos reserva e chegamos com antecedÃªncia e fomos rapidamente colocados em uma mesa que vagou. Excelente comida! Recomendo o creme de espinafre que Ã© delicioso e o Meatball. Atendimento muito bom.
Great food, friendly staff .

Love Friedmanâ€™s! Really comfortable but classy place. Bartender Obed was very welcoming, friendly, and prompt. My B.E.L.T. was delicious! Over-easy eggs and bacon were perfectly prepared, the tomato and lettuce were fresh, and the toast tasted like it was just baked this morning. Iâ€™ll definitely be coming back tomorrow!
De huevos
Delicioso y servicio excelente!

There was a lot of variety beers and cocktails. The food selection wasnâ€™t bad either. The place was a little small inside with some outside seating. Itâ€™s close to Jacob Javits Center so itâ€™s good for after conventions.
More importantly the food was very good and the service attentive. I had the brick chicken which was moist and well-seasoned. The pastrami sandwich that my husband had was solid.

This place is a great restaurant! ğŸ´ Friedman's offers a wonderful variety of delicious ğŸ¤¤ dishes ğŸ½ï¸ with a large gluten free selection - definitely try the Mac & Cheese ğŸ§€, the Artichoke Dip and Chips, and Chicken ğŸ— Swiss Sandwich! ğŸ¥ª The staff ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ³ is super friendly, welcoming, and helpful! The service is quick â²ï¸, ambience ğŸ¶ is great, strong air conditioning ğŸŒ¬ï¸, and they have lots of indoor seating!ğŸª‘ I wish I came here more often!
Amazing selection of gluten free items! As a celiac, I felt very safe eating here. Would highly recommend brunch, lunch or dinner! Service is friendly and attentive (a plus)!

Had breakfast here with my family, was looking forward to trying this as had been seeing queues out the door all week.

I had a breakfast burrito which was a bit underwhelming and lacked seasoning. However, the atmosphere in there was great and service quick and friendly. Reasonably pricing.

Would go back and try something new!

Good hearty food to get your day moving in NYC.

The spinach and artichoke dip was the highlight, just the right amount of cheese with the spinach flavour makes a great dip with the tortilla chips.

The pastrami was nice and reminded me of home cooked food. The falafel burger was a bit dense for me, but a great choice for vegetarians. Lastly the French toast was a delight, with a touch of cinnamon through, the compote paired perfectly.

First time coming here by myself. The servers  kindly seated me a table and brought my food with ease. Throughout the entire dining experience, the servers were each considerate to check up on me if I needed something.
The Farm Egg Omelette taste warm and delicious to bite into. Especially the toast with the avocado. I understand the avocado is meant for the omelette, but I got curious and add little bit of avocado to the toast. It actually tasted good than just spreading butter on the toast. So don't hesitate to try it yourself. For dessert, I got the New York Style Cheesecake and it was deliciously sweet.

If you are coming in as a group, be considerate of the other diners eating here.  It  can get a little noisy, but people can still hear others based on what your voice volume is.

Overall, I enjoyed the experience here and would come again either by myself or with friends with a less full stomach. (I wanted to try the burgers but I was kinda full when I came to the restaurant, so I chose the omelette instead. Still delicious though, don't get me wrong. T_T)

To say that Iâ€™m a fan may be a complete understatement. The first time I stumbled upon Friedmanâ€™s was quite possibly in May 2025 and I didnâ€™t write a review at that point but when I immediately returned to NY this weekend, I ate there both Saturday and today (Sunday), both times for breakfast although I tried to go for dinner last night too (no availability). My favorite thing on the breakfast menu is the banana bread with the fruit and berries with the yogurt (add a side order of bacon). It is delicious and since first enjoying this, Iâ€™ve made a version a few times. Friedmanâ€™s is better. This morning I had the Lemon Ricotta pancakes. They were amazing!! The portions are large and presented very well! Itâ€™s not a huge menu but a thoughtful menu and you will change your mind several times prior to placing your order which is a great problem for a restaurant to have. Iâ€™ll be back in a month and my first stop will again be Friedmanâ€™s. Canâ€™t wait!

Itâ€™s just OK and there are plenty of other options in the neighborhood or similar NYC Diners all over town.

In both times that I visited the food was just OK. Nothing too tasty or impressive.

Granola: very basic granola and yogurt. Not worth it. Motel 8 level.

Grilled Cheese on Challah: the two pieces were very small, the cheese very basic and a few pieces of tomato. Didnâ€™t want to finish it.

Eggs Benedict: creative base decision with the Latke instead of bread.

Overall, not worth it.

Amazing gluten free food and exceptional service!! I could have eaten the entire menu.... The best Gluten Free pancakes in the world!!!

Thank you for allowing coeliacs to enjoy delicious treats in New York!

This waitress service was Awesome, the best weâ€™ve had in New York in a long time.  However the cook over cooked our steak and fried chicken (which was almost burnt and very DRY as well as disappointing.  The chicken wings were awesome and better than the chicken dinner.  Every thing else was good.  The disappointing part of my visit was that the manager didnâ€™t want pictures of the kitchen which was very visible from the restaurant seating area and when you come out of the restroom.  The tables were very clean.  As soon as the customers leave they clean and sanitize the area right away.  But the kitchen maybe something else.  Go and make your own opinion about the restaurant.  The staff are very friendly and attentive to their customers needs.  The restaurant honors Veterans also with dinning discounts.

Great restaurant that has stood the test of time. Recently went back after not going into the area for a while. Better than ever. Great option for gluten free and normal people too. ğŸ« 

Mahayla is a great waiter that really stands out as a reason we will come back along with the great food. And I can see from all the staff that they focus on hiring kind people who can communicate effectively.

This Friedman's Club is incredible.

One of our favorite restaurants to go when in New York.

Great food, great service, and very user friendly way to pay your bill.
Loved this meal - tasty, cozy location and lots of GF options for those in our group that needed it.

Service was excellent especially from Jia and Alberto.
We had no reservation,  but they accommodated us.
The food was terrific  and sufficient.
The prices are friendly to the pocket.
They could be more generous with lemon slices;).

FÃ¼r uns das beste Pastrami Sandwich in New York, es hat uns sogar besser geschmeckt als bei Katz. Ich wÃ¼rde es jederzeit vorziehen, vor allem ist der Services netter und man steht keine Stunde an. Gerne wieder
Food was great host and staff were very inviting and made my son and myself happy. Food was great I wanted more ğŸ¤¤
Excellent for a late breakfast at 11am. Great service, coffee is good, the view from the window is very pleasant. Eggs and canadian bacon is a good choice.

Absolutely delicious food! I had the Korean wings and as a Korean foodie who has been to South Korea multiple times, I can tell you, this is as authentic Korean wings you can get from an American restaurant. Super delicious and authentic!
I also had the roasted salmon dish. Also super good and didnâ€™t leave any crumbsâ€¦like at all.

Not to mention the staff is fabulous. I was welcomed by the restaurant manager, Uma who was super friendly and mentioned how he liked my name, something I rarely hear. We also had a short conversation about the meaning of my name. Then I had the absolute honor of being served by Mahayla. Her energy was infectious in the most beautiful way, not to mention very funny.

If yall are ever choosing between places to go to, definitely go to this one for good food & good vibes all around!

Amazing! Great spot for lunch! They offered many different options and I went with the buttermilk chicken sandwich, which was amazing! The ambience was very very busy and probably due to the Car show nearby. Overall, everyone in our party enjoyed the food minus one member not enjoying the burger. I will return.

The food was amazing! The salmon bowl was filling and healthy and the famous patty melt was juicy!! We also ordered yuka fries on the side which were also delicious but unnecessary since everything else was so filling. The drinks were also delicious and there was happy hour from 4-6PM on a Saturday. Highly recommend to anyone who wants a healthy meal with a nice drink that's affordable.
The best gluten free pancakes I have had in years!! Breakfast here was sublime.  So many gluten free choices and our choices were delicious! Highly recommend for breakfast!!

We visited this place by chance as we were staying at a hotel in the area and it was the best brunch we have ever had!
On weekends there are queues and you will have to wait to be seated, but the wait is worth it.
It has a large menu with options for brunch, but also burgers and many gluten-free options.
Everything we tried was amazing, but my favorite was the pastrami sandwich!
It also serves high quality coffee.
The staff are all very friendly and kind!
For coffee and brunch estimate about $70 per couple.

As many times as I need to shout this out, GO FOR THE CHIX & WAFFS! You won't regret it! Crispy, juicy, fluffy, spicy all meshed into one.

It can get very busy here over lunch time, so if you know what's good for you, try to navigate here outside of peak hours or it's going to be helluva wait.

TLDR: New American fare. Probably one of the only reasonably priced places in the area. I'm down with the sandwiches. Turkey club, tuna melt or Reuben. Also, get the fries.

I don't really go for places that look like this. Is don't really gravitate towards this type of food but in an area where everything is crazy expensive, Friedman's is that one beacon of light that offers tasty filling food for a reasonable cost.

The tuna melt has been my jam. Crusty rye, melty cheese, just the right gooeyness. The fries are well-seasoned, crispy and I hate ketchup but they always accommodate and sub an aioli.

The Reuben is solid too if you're in the pastrami mood. Juicy hand-sliced meat, tangy dressing, sauerkraut and that melted Swiss. Recently though, the turkey club. Cranberry aioli is something I would have gagged at the thought of years ago but I'm into it. Salty bacon, tender turkey, it's piled high and just got so much flavor. So yeah - I am a fan now.

Fabulous food, adorable atmosphere. So cozy inside, beautiful wood everywhere you turn. Waiter was proactive about food allergies which I appreciated immensely. LOTS of gluten free options/availability. I had some eggs Benedict and a dirty chai latte, both of which were superb. Would totally come here again and again every time Iâ€™m in town.

Service: A bit slow at times and didnâ€™t understand everything, got a couple of things wrong. However, friendly people.
Food: While the (GF) sandwich of my companion was excellent, the burger and the wings were mediocre. Both very fatty, I felt a little nauseous afterwards.
Ambiance: Quite packed, not a lot of space, but interior wise totally OK
Lovely place. Friendly staff. Tasty food!

Ok comenzamos hoy es la opiniÃ³n de mi hijo Mateo que es su cumpleaÃ±os, en servicio la chica Molly E es increÃ­ble en su atenciÃ³n me felicito por mi cumpleaÃ±os y es el primer lugar donde le hace un corazÃ³n a mi mamÃ¡ en su cafÃ©, la comida muy rica vale la pena ir mÃ¡s por la papas frita ğŸ«£ğŸ«£ todo 10000/10.. gracias por la atenciÃ³n de todos volverÃ­amos mil veces mÃ¡s
Service top notch-fast, pleasant and accomodating. Food was delicious and fresh. We ordered 4 1/3 meals for 4 people. Restaurant was a little chilly but it is a cold and rainy day so not surprising.

OK, we got there at 8:30 thinking that was the time they opened. We were wrong as that was the opening of the Chelsea property.

My daughter, myself and four other women were standing out in front and the manager told us that they didnâ€™t open till nine and then proceeded to ask if we would like coffee while we waited while they continued to set up.

WELL DONE, SIR!

9 oâ€™clock rolls around, doors open, and we are seated. Service was excellent, and food even more so.
Mahayla  Nous a donner un excellent service. Un service 5 Ã©toile. Garder la, car elle as une super Ã©nergie. La gaufre au poulet Ã©tait excellent. Et mes amis on aussi trÃ¨s apprÃ©ciÃ©.

Food was delicious and our waitress Camilla was so kind and thoughtful! Her warm attitude elevated our meal and made it truly enjoyable. Service like this is rare, and it reflects the restaurantâ€™s commitment to excellence.

Coming from Arizona for the week. First restaurant we stopped at. Amazing food with flavors throughout every bite. Packed amazing atmosphere, good music as well. Server sat us real quick and we got our food fast as well.

Great place to grab lunch in the Hudson Yards area.  I had a cheeseburger and fries.  Was absolutely delicious.  Was prepared just the way I wanted, and was served promptly.  Service was excellent.  Our server was friendly and very efficient.  Atmosphere is cozy and charming, as well as being most welcoming.  Highly recommend, and can't wait to try other offerings on the menu.
